title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. Designation of military installations selected for closure or realignment as enterprise zones by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for community development purposes. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations selected for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas under the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965. The designations must be made within 60 days. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas within 60 days of the recommendation for closure or realignment in a base closure report transmitted to Congress. The Act requires designations of enterprise zones to be made within 60 days. Designated installations are additional to existing enterprise zones authorized under a previous Act. Funding for designated enterprise zones may come from proceeds of a course of action required by another Act. The Act allows funding for enterprise zones from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or Commerce for economic adjustment or community planning in connection with military installation closure. Designated military installations as redevelopment areas remain in effect for 5 years, with annual reviews conducted by the Secretary of Commerce. The Act allows funding for enterprise zones from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or Commerce for economic adjustment in connection with military installation closure. Designated military installations as redevelopment areas remain in effect for 5 years, with annual reviews conducted by the Secretary of Commerce. The base closure law includes the Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 and the Defense Authorization Amendments and Base Closure and Realignment Act. Substantial realignment refers to a reduction in operations. Substantial realignment is defined as a significant reduction in the operation of a military installation, where 50 percent or more of personnel, including civilian employees and Armed Forces members, are reassigned to another military installation. Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas is emphasized. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of buildings on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas for assisting the homeless until certain conditions are met. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of buildings on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas for assisting the homeless until specific conditions are met, as certified by the Secretary of Defense and the Secretary of Commerce.
